title: Longest Common Prefix
description:
Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.

If there is no common prefix, return an empty string "".

Example 1:
  Input: strs = ["flower","flow","flight"]
  Output: "fl"

Example 2:
  Input: strs = ["dog","racecar","car"]
  Output: ""
  Explanation: There is no common prefix among the input strings.
check_function:
def check(candidate):
    assert candidate(["flower","flow","flight"]) == "fl"
    assert candidate(["dog","racecar","car"]) == ""
    assert candidate(["a"]) == "a"
    assert candidate([""]) == ""
    assert candidate(["abc","abc","abc"]) == "abc"
    assert candidate(["ab","a"]) == "a"
    assert candidate(["cir","car"]) == "c"
    assert candidate(["reflower","flow","flight"]) == ""
    assert candidate(["aaa","aa","aab"]) == "aa"
    assert candidate(["x","x","x","x"]) == "x"
